p: Globally H6Nx viruses are becoming an increasingly persistent burden for the poultry industry [ 17], with frequent introductions incurring large scale disease. H6Nx viruses also boast the most extensive host species range compared to other subtypes [ 18], and recent evidence, explored in this review, suggests that H6Nx viruses harbour several molecular signatures indicative of mammalian adaptation therefore posing a potential risk to human health. This review aims to summarise the global distribution, evolution, host tropism infectivity and transmissibility and human health risk posed by H6Nx AIVs.
